text: The Beretta 93R is an Italian 9mm caliber pistol manufactured by Beretta. == Description == It allows firing both in semi-automatic mode (one shot each time the trigger is pulled) and three-shot bursts (three shots each time the trigger is pulled). This pistol is based on the Beretta 92 semi-automatic. It was designed in the 1970s for police and military use. This pistol has a folding foregrip (to stabilize it when shooting in bursts), a muzzle brake, and can optionally be used with a stock. It uses 20-round magazines. Its rate of fire in three-shot burst mode is 1,100 rounds per minute. == References == Category:Pistols
title: Beretta 93R
